thread.title: Former Alabama teammates, foes mourn Tenpenny's death
thread.title_full: Former Alabama teammates, foes mourn Tenpenny's death

title: Former Alabama teammates, foes mourn Tenpenny's death
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Former Alabama teammates, foes mourn Tenpenny's death Alabama players have taken to social media to mourn the death of former Crimson Tide running back Altee Tenpenny, who died in a car accident Tuesday. Post to Facebook Former Alabama teammates, foes mourn Tenpenny's death Alabama players have taken to social media to mourn the death of former Crimson Tide running back Altee Tenpenny, who died in a car accident Tuesday. Check out this story on montgomeryadvertiser.com: http://on.mgmadv.com/1LLMxoo Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation Duane Rankin , Montgomery Advertiser 12:09 p.m. CDT October 21, 2015 
Former Alabama running back Altee Tenpenny died in a car accident Tuesday (Photo: USA TODAY Sports) 
Alabama players have taken to social media to mourn the death of former Crimson Tide running back Altee Tenpenny, who died in a car accident Tuesday. 
Senior running back Kenyan Drake posted an Instagram tribute in which he opened by saying "the tears never stopped since I heard the news." I hate that I lost contact with my brother. We really lost a good one. Fly high homie üôèüèæ R.I.P. Altee Tenpenny ‚Äî Kenyan Drake‚Ñ¢ (@KDx17) October 21, 2015 
Alabama junior offensive guard Alphonse Taylor tweeted an emotional reaction to the news as well. He has a picture of Tenpenny running the ball as the backdrop photo on his Twitter page. RIP big Cuz Rodrick Lucy 
RIP Altee Tenpenny 
y God take yall from me the same night or why he took yall from me at all I dont understand üôèüèæ ‚Äî Alphonse Taylor (@SHANKK50) October 21, 2015 
Auburn sophomore defensive end Carl Lawson also shared his condolences. R.I.P. Altee Tenpenny ‚Äî carl lawson (@carllawson14) October 21, 2015 
A four-star recruit, Tenpenny spent two seasons at Alabama where he rushed for just 218 yards and a touchdown, but transferred to UNLV after the 2014 season. He was dismissed from UNLV in August for breaking teams rules. 
The North Little Rock, Ark., native wound up at FCS school Nicholls State, but was dismissed after being arrested Sunday for possession of a firearm and discharging a weapon. Two days later, Tenpenny died in a one-vehicle car accident in which he was thrown from the vehicle in Mississippi while heading back to Arkansas from Nicholls State. 
"Our thoughts and prayers are with Altee and his family," Alabama coach Nick Saban said on this morning's SEC coaches' call. "This is obviously a tragedy. This was a guy that was in our program and good friends with a lot of our players. We want to be as supportive as possible with all the people who are affected by this." 
When you look at Seattle Seahawks running back Fred Jackson surviving a car accident and seeing Tenpenny lose his life in his, it just shows how fortunate and how fragile life is. #RIP Altee Tenpenny! Rest in Heaven bro! #BamaPsiPhi4Life !!!! ‚Äî LeRon McClain (@LeRon_McClain33) October 21, 2015 #RIP to former Alabama RB Altee Tenpenny. Rest easy pic.twitter.com/gU6304lYhC ‚Äî Alabama Logo‚Ñ¢ (@TheAlabamaLogo) October 21, 2015 We enjoyed covering Altee Tenpenny‚Äôs FB journey. Prayers go out to his family, friends %26 teammates. #RIPAltee pic.twitter.com/GnyObDeYuh
